p: Slugs are important pests in a wide range of horticultural and arable crops [ 1, 2] and the more frequent use of conservation tillage in agriculture is leading to an increase in slug pest problems around the world [ 3], especially when some of them are invasive species. The spread of invasive species constitutes one of the most important drivers for the global change of biodiversity and ecosystems [ 4]. The slug, Arion vulgaris Moquin-Tandon, 1855 (syn. Arion lusitanicus auct. non-Mabille, 1868), is an invasive species which has spread and become established in many European countries since the 1950s [ 5, 6].
